events.text: [color=#ffed29](Ugh...)
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]Good morning, [tootroot]!
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]......

Hmm, I thought you would’ve started to sprout today?
Maybe you need more food.
I’ll put out some more lettuce for you!
I’ll put out some more peaches for you!
I’ll put out some more tomatoes for you!
Gramma, not again...
Gramma!
Orven Angelo Zanry, what did I tell you about keeping your word?
Child, don’t tell me you forgot.
I’m sorry, Gramma, I don’t know what you’re talking about?
Boy, you told me that you would call me last night!
You were so worried about me waking up early, and you gave me a big stink about how you are enough of an adult to wake up on your own.
And then you forget to call your own Gramma!
[color=#ffed29](Oh shoot, I think we had this conversation yesterday morning.)
[color=#ffed29](That’s what I was supposed to do last night…)
Gramma, I’m super sorry. I got distracted last night!
And what do you think that sorry excuse will do for me?
A Tootroot came to my house!

A Tootroot?
Wow, after all those years of begging me to get one, one showed right up to your house!
Right? I couldn’t believe it!
What’d you end up doing with it?
I let her go…
Really! After all that whining about getting one, it ends up on your lap, and you let it go?
Not an it! Her name was [tootroot]!
And she looked like she wanted out, so I let her out…

Good for you, child, one less mouth to feed.
You just started your job, too, you ain’t got time for a pet!
It wasn’t about that, I can handle a Tootroot.
I just thought she’d be happier outside, so I let her go.

Sweet baby, you did the right thing.
Didn’t you say they visited homes? Maybe you’ll see her again someday!
I sure hope so…
Chin up, you still got your old Gramma here.
[i]Haha[/i], and I’m lucky to have you.
So don’t forget to take care of ME! I’ll be expecting a call TONIGHT, you understand?
[i]Haha[/i], and I’m lucky to have you.
Goodness starts with you, child. Go make a difference in the world.
[color=#ffed29](Maybe I’ll leave my door slightly open…just in case.)
I kept her!
You kept her?!
You know I did all that research on them! I got this!
Before you even buy a proper side table for your phone, you got a pet.
This is classic Orven, you know that, right?
Neither of us can fight destiny, Gramma!
Did you name her?
Yeah! It’s [tootroot]!
[i]Haha[/i], of course you would name your Tootroot that.
Well, you take good care of her, and don’t forget ME!
I’ll be expecting a call TONIGHT, with or without [tootroot]!

Understood, loud and clear!
Love you!
Goodness starts with you, child. Go make a difference in the world.
That was my Gramma, hopefully one day you’ll get to meet her!
I gotta go to work now, but I’ll give you a couple pets before I go.
[i]smile
See you, girl!
Gramma, I’m [i]so[/i] sorry. I’ll call you tonight for sure.
That’s a promise? You know I’m gonna be waitin’ for you and your forgetful voice after dinner.
A promise, a promise. I’ll remember this time.
Alright then, child, I love you.
I love you, too, Gramma!
Don’t you go forgettin’ about me.
I won’t, I wont. Sorry, it won’t happen again.
Alright, then, just wanna make sure my favorite person in the world remembers the person who loves him most.
I love you and appreciate you!
Goodness starts with you, child. Go make a difference in the world.
SHOOT, I GOTTA SHOWER.

[color=#ffed29](Oh, great…of course, when I’m in the shower.)
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]ONE MINUTE!!!
Great, that was probably Gramma.

[color=#ffed29](But I gotta go to work…)
Sorry, Gramma, I’ll call you later!!!
[color=#ffed29](Quick breakfast and go!)
[color=#ffed29](Oh! And I can’t forget!)
Good morning, [tootroot]!

Hmm, I thought you would’ve started to sprout today?
Maybe you need more food.
I’ll put out some more lettuce for you!
I’ll put out some more peaches for you!
I’ll put out some more tomatoes for you!
See you, girl!
[i]Yawn...
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]Good morning, [tootroot]!
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]......

Hmm, I thought you would’ve started to sprout today?
Maybe you need more food.
I’ll put out some more lettuce for you!
I’ll put out some more peaches for you!
I’ll put out some more tomatoes for you!

Now that I called Gramma at night, I’ve got some time in the morning!
I’ll make my breakfast and then I’ll think about what to do.
[color=#ffed29](Who doesn’t love French Toast, fresh fruit, some honey, and whipped cream?)
[color=#ffed29](What do I want to do…)

[color=#ffed29](…if it’s not in Mister Avidine’s factory, then I’m not sure what I wanna do.)
[color=#ffed29](I just want to help people who can’t help themselves.)
[color=#ffed29](If I didn’t use what I have now to help others…I dunno, it would feel like all that Gramma and Grampa did were in vain.)
AH!
Well, I guess you can strikeout chef off the list. Talked so much game and I forgot the splatter guard.

Well, I’m not going to make any headway thinking in circles like this.
Might as well do something productive, like eat.
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1][i]MMMmmm!!!
And a couple of berries and veggies for you, too, [tootroot]!
[i]smile
[color=#ffed29](And I can’t forget about today’s lunch.)
[color=#ffed29](Let’s make something that Herb and Mrs. Langtree would like.)
[color=#ffed29](What do I have in my fridge?)

[color=#ffed29](Uhh, let’s see.)
[color=#ffed29](There’s: heavy cream, butter, various cheeses, broccoli, peppers, asparagus, garlic, onions, eggs, blueberries, and strawberries, and yogurt in the fridge.)
[color=#ffed29](And in the freezer, I got shrimp, chorizo, and this skirt steak.)
[color=#ffed29](Ooh, and this ice-cream—that is nobody’s but mine.)
[color=#ffed29](Pantry’s got some bow-ties, spaghetti, and lil’ shells. Tomatoes. Also got some bread and rice and sweet potatoes.)
[color=#ffed29](Steak, tomatoes, onions over rice sounds [i]pretty[/i] good if you ask me.)
[color=#ffed29](Can’t go wrong with seafood. I can make some creamy shrimp pasta with some asparagus on the side.)
[color=#ffed29](Maybe like a chorizo and egg breakfast sandwich? Who doesn’t like breakfast?)
[color=#ffed29](And I’ll pack some spices so that Herb can guess which ones I put in.)
Alright! All set.

[color=#ffed29](What are some sweet potato dishes I can do…)
[color=#ffed29](I shouldn’t go sweet since Mister Avidine doesn't like sweet potato casseroles.)
[color=#ffed29](I’ve been waiting for an excuse to try making gnocchi.)
[color=#ffed29](And it’s for Mister Avidine, so I might as well show off a little, right?)
[color=#ffed29](Gotta love a warm baked potato.)

[color=#ffed29](And I won’t be cheap with the toppings—butter, chives, bacon, sour cream, cheese, all the good stuff.)
[color=#ffed29](Can’t go wrong with that.)

[color=#ffed29](Maybe a sweet potato salad?)
[color=#ffed29](I think I had this one time at a restaurant, and it was super good. Can’t be too hard to replicate.)
[color=#ffed29](Plus it’s healthy and light!)
[color=#ffed29](Fancy adults love healthy stuff, right?)

[color=#ffed29](This way, no matter what happens today, Mister Avidine will have one good thing happen to him.)
[color=#ffed29](I hope he likes it.)
[color=#ffed29](…I hope he knows how grateful I am.)
He’ll get it…he’ll get it.
